Phrase en Anglais: ${color-alt: 161}A mog tablet has been discovered in ${choice: 0}[West Ronfaure/East Ronfaure/the La Theine Plateau/the Valkurm Dunes/Jugner Forest/the Batallia Downs/North Gustaberg/South Gustaberg/the Konschtat Highlands/the Pashhow Marshlands/the Rolanberry Fields/Beaucedine Glacier/Xarcabard/West Sarutabaruta/East Sarutabaruta/the Tahrongi Canyon/the Buburimu Peninsula/the Meriphataud Mountains/the Sauromugue Champaign/Qufim Island/Behemoth's Dominion/Cape Teriggan/the Eastern Altepa Desert/the Sanctuary of Zi'Tah/Ro'Maeve/the Yuhtunga Jungle/the Yhoator Jungle/the Western Altepa Desert/the Valley of Sorrows]!

Phrase en Anglais: I eat, breathe, and sleep delivery services! Even if the heavens come tumbling down, the seas engulf all of Adoulin, or eternal darkness descends upon the world, you needn't worry about your package!${prompt}
Phrase en Français: Je mange, je respire et je dors grâce aux services de livraison ! Même si les cieux s'écroulent, que les mers engloutissent tout Adoulin ou que les ténèbres éternelles s'abattent sur le monde, vous n'avez pas à vous soucier de votre colis !${prompt}

Phrase en Français: 遠征先リージョンナンバー${number: 0}

Phrase en Anglais: 現在のリージョンナンバー　${number: 1}${prompt}
Ahead of you lies the Al Zahbi residential area.
You may use the rooms within just as you would a Mog House in your home nation.${prompt}
Ahead of you lies the Al Zahbi residential area.
All adventurers must lease a Rent-a-Room if they wish to enter.${prompt}
In the event that you decide to lease a Rent-a-Room, your stored items will be moved to Al Zahbi and you will be able to use your new room like the Mog House in your home country.${prompt}
Lease a Rent-a-Room in Al Zahbi?
It seems we are finished here. Congratulations--you now have an Al Zahbi Rent-a-Room at your disposal.${prompt}
Welcome, Master! This is your home, the “Mog House,” kupo!${prompt}
I'm a moogle! We moogles like taking care of houses and items! Nice to meet you, kupo!${prompt}
I'll tell you all about your Mog House, kupo!${prompt}
Open your main menu, Master. The button at the very bottom changes to “Mog House” when you're in your Mog House, kupo!${prompt}
Press it and the “Mog House” menu will appear! Everything you can do in your Mog House is there, kupo!${prompt}
There are lots of things you can do in your Mog House, kupo! It can be too much for some masters, kupo...${prompt}
So I'll teach you about each one of them! Ask me what you want to know about, kupo!${prompt}
Choose the Mog House command you want to know about, kupo!${prompt}
What do you want to know about?
The Mog Safe is where I keep items that you can't carry! It's an especially secure and solid safe, kupo!${prompt}
You can only put so many items in it, kupo... But I'll guard them even if it means my life, kupo!${prompt}
The Delivery Box is where you can send letters to friends and receive items from various places, kupo!${prompt}
You should take the items from your Delivery Box and put them in your inventory when they arrive, kupo!${prompt}
If your Delivery Box is full, no more deliveries can be made, and you can't send any mail either, kupo!${prompt}
You can send items and gil to your friends with the “Send” command, kupo!${prompt}
(Sometimes, if a special force takes hold, you can even deliver items with the "Exclusive" attribute, kupo...!)${prompt}
Changing people's jobs is a secret ability only we moogles can use, kupo!${prompt}
I take off all your equipment and take you to a mysterious place, kupo!${prompt}
And...the rest is a secret, kupo!${prompt}
All moogles like taking care of plants, kupo!${prompt}
As long as you have a flowerpot and seeds, I'll make it my personal responsibility to look after the plants you raise, kupo!${prompt}
This Mog House is your very own room, kupo! But it's still a little bare, kupo...${prompt}
It needs some furniture and maybe some paintings to make it more cozy, kupo!${prompt}
If you find any during your travels, I'll help you lay them out, kupo! I can't wait, kupo!${prompt}
Storage space becomes available when you place furniture in your Mog House using the “Layout” command, kupo!${prompt}
It's almost exactly the same as using your Mog Safe, kupo!
Leave your items here for me to look after, kupo!${prompt}
You can invite party and alliance members into your Mog House, kupo!${prompt}
You can show off your expensive furniture, have tea parties, plan your next great adventure--the possibilities are endless, kupo!${prompt}
Are you sure, kupo? You know everything about your Mog House, kupo?${prompt}
And finally, a little bit of advice!${prompt}
If you ever run into any problems, just ask your fellow adventurers for help!${prompt}
If you type “/ae Hello!”, then your message will be heard by many people.${prompt}
If you type “/ae” followed by your issue or question, other adventurers will help you!${prompt}
Remember that you can only do this while in town, kupo!${prompt}
Good luck on your adventuring, kupo!${prompt}
Do you want me to teach you about your Mog House again, kupo?${prompt}
Ask about your Mog House again?
Over the mountains and the rolling hills,
I'll go wherever my master wills.♪${prompt}
I traveled all the way here at your bidding, kupo! Even a Rent-a-Room needs a moogle, kupo!${prompt}
But there are a few things you can't do in a Rent-a-Room, kupo. Select “Mog House” from the main menu and check, kupo!${prompt}
When you go back home, talk to the guard in front of the residential area to call me back to the Mog House, kupo!${prompt}
I have something to tell you, kupo!${prompt}
I found this precious item under the ${item-singular: 3[2]} pillow, kupo!${prompt}
I used the ${item-singular: 3[2]} to write a song for you, kupo!${prompt}
Here, kupo! Please think of the lonely moogle waiting for you back home when you hear this song, kupo!${prompt}
I found this item in the back of one of the ${item-singular: 3[2]}'s drawers, kupo!${prompt}
I found this in the back of the ${item-singular: 3[2]}, kupo!${prompt}
It must be a gift from the heavens, kupo!
I found this item inside the ${item-singular: 3[2]}, kupo!${prompt}
Luck is on your side, kupo!
I fished this item out of the ${item-singular: 3[2]}, kupo!${prompt}
It was very hard work, kupo...
I found this behind the ${item-singular: 3[2]} painting, kupo!${prompt}
This must be what they mean when they say, there are many mysteries behind works of art, kupo!
Something clattered inside the ${item-singular: 3[2]} when I shook it! Look what fell out when I turned it upside down, kupo!${prompt}
I felt there was something strange about the ${item-singular: 3[2]}, and when I looked into it, I found this, kupo!${prompt}
We moogles have very good intuition, kupo!
Oh, Master! You won't believe what I found out on the doorstep this morning, kupo!${prompt}
At once so glorious and so ghastly, and just for you!
Think of it as a holiday gift from a humble moogle to his favorite (and only) master, kupo!${prompt}
For your own safety, it is recommended you set the Mog House exit as your home point after changing jobs.${prompt}

Is my assistance reaching you, Master? Your Mog House is currently aglow with ${choice: 0}[overwhelming/powerful/faint] ${choice: 1}[fire/ice/wind/earth/lightning/water/light/dark] energy, kupo!${prompt}
Is my assistance reaching you, Master? Your Mog House is currently aglow with ${choice: 0}[the overwhelming/the powerful/the faint] energy of many different elements, kupo!${prompt}

Each item of furniture you place using the “Layout” command corresponds to a different element, kupo! The type of energy that envelops your Mog House changes depending on those elements, kupo!${prompt}
When that energy changes, my powers change as well, kupo! Master, you should try placing all sorts of furniture in your Mog House, kupo!${prompt}
I sense that this ${item-singular: 3[2]} is very, very special! You should go to the store where you bought it and ask about it, kupo!${prompt}
Look what I found underneath the ${item-singular: 3[2]} this morning, kupo!${prompt}

Our main function is to commission mercenaries with the tasks set forth by the Imperial Government.${prompt}
We have an abundance of commissions for the hardy mercenary!${prompt}
Our commissions are only available to authorized mercenaries of level 50 or above.
Please return when you meet the necessary requirements.${prompt}
You have completed mercenary registration procedures?
I have you registered as “${name-player}” under Salaheem's Sentinels.
Your paperwork appears to be in order.${prompt}
I shall now give you an explanation of “Assault,” the main type of work we have available here at the Commissions Agency.${prompt}
“Assault” is the name given to a series of missions being conducted by the Imperial Army in the heart of enemy territory.${prompt}
Our function is to commission mercenaries with these missions as set forth by the Empire.${prompt}
To participate in an Assault mission, you must first obtain ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
The ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will identify you as a legitimate Assault participant.${prompt}

The personnel at this counter will provide you with ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, but please be aware that only one can be issued every ${choice: 1}[day/ten minutes] (Earth time), and we are only able to hold up to three for you.${prompt}
Mercenaries that have a confirmed mission will not be issued ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
To once again become eligible to receive ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, please report to this counter after completing an Assault mission.${prompt}
Next, I shall explain how to sign up for an Assault mission.${prompt}
You will see a number of counters here to your left.${prompt}
Each of these counters is responsible for a particular Assault area.${prompt}
The personnel at these counters will give you a detailed explanation of the available Assault missions.${prompt}

However, you will only be able to undertake Assault missions that correspond to your mercenary rank. The Commissions Agency is prohibited by Imperial law from disclosing mission information to persons without the proper level of clearance.${prompt}
After selecting a mission, present your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} for verification.${prompt}
Assault missions are only open to mercenaries of level 50 or above. Please be sure your job is of the appropriate level before signing up.${prompt}
This concludes the explanation for Assault participation.
Next, I will list some points to remember when beginning an Assault mission.${prompt}
Assault missions have a minimum member requirement.
This figure represents the number of party members who must be present in order to begin the mission.${prompt}
Please form a party with a sufficient number of members who have all signed up for the same Assault mission. ${prompt}
After forming a party, make your way to the mission staging point located at the entrance to the applicable Assault area.${prompt}
To facilitate a speedy journey to the staging point, I would suggest utilizing the “runic portal” within the “Chamber of Passage” located opposite this building.${prompt}
Please be aware that in order to utilize the runic portal from the Chamber of Passage, you must first attune yourself to the runic portal found at the staging point in question.${prompt}
Under normal circumstances, use of the runic portal will deplete your Imperial Standing. However, persons in possession of Assault orders are exempt from this charge.${prompt}
Upon arriving at the staging point, a representative from your Assault party should speak with the Immortal on duty to receive verification of command.${prompt}
The verified representative should then activate the “runic seal” at the entrance to begin the Assault mission.${prompt}
This concludes the basics for beginning an Assault mission.
Next, we will cover the main points to consider during the mission itself.${prompt}
When an Assault mission begins, you will be transported to an area where the level of enemies is based on the highest-level member of your party.${prompt}
It is also possible to accept a voluntary level restriction during Assault. In this case, your party will be sent to an area based upon the adjusted level limit.${prompt}
Once you have arrived in the area, the time limit for the mission will be announced. If you do not complete the mission objectives within this time, the mission will be considered a failure.${prompt}
To successfully complete a mission, it is necessary to activate the “rune of release” that appears after the mission objectives have been fulfilled.${prompt}
It is possible to abandon a mission and be transported out of the Assault area by using homing fireflies to guide you. Naturally, the mission will be considered a failure in this case.${prompt}
Before being transported to the Assault area, all party members will be issued with homing fireflies.${prompt}
Homing fireflies are temporary items that cannot be taken out of an Assault area.${prompt}
Other temporary items will also be available during Assault missions.${prompt}
This concludes the Assault mission explanation.
Lastly, I will give you an overview of the rewards available upon successfully completing an Assault mission.${prompt}
After successfully completing an Assault mission, the Empire will award you with Assault Points.${prompt}
These points are only awarded for participation in Assault missions, and are accumulated separately for each Assault area.${prompt}
Each area has specific items available that can be purchased in exchange for Assault Points.${prompt}

The Kingdom of Zhwa is an island nation found in the southern seas. Ever since the time of Koja Zhwan, a close friend of Imperial hero Balrahn, successive generations of this remote country have been entrusted with the defense of the Empire's interests.${prompt}
After hearing of the beastman threat to the Empire, President Naja...ahem, Princess Naja...led a force of Zhwan soldiers across the waves to assist the distant capital of Al Zahbi.${prompt}

After leading her army to Al Zahbi and being disgusted by the corrupt state of the Imperial Army, President Naja decided to establish her own mercenary company...without any kind of authorization.${prompt}

She was then accused of inciting civil strife by the Immortals! This case escalated into a scandal in which the Kingdom of Zhwa was stripped of its autonomy and the Zhwan royal family was threatened with obliteration.${prompt}

Thankfully, the recently-inaugurated Empress Nashmeira II reduced the Zhwan family's punishment to a suspension of powers, and then formally recognized Salaheem's Sentinels as a legitimate company.${prompt}
But, with matters as they were, President Naja was forced to borrow the capital to fund her mercenary enterprise. The island princess had been disowned by her own family...${prompt}

The Spiritreaver M-400 head has been programmed with a state-of-the-art black mage algorithm that is guaranteed to significantly increase spell processing efficiency.${prompt}
To construct this head I will require ${article} ${item-article: 8[2]} and my usual fee of ${number: 6} ${item-given-plurality: 6[2], 5[2]}.${prompt}
In addition, you will also need to bring me a ${choice: 16}[white/black] mage scroll so I can program its data patterns into the head's control center.${prompt}
If possible, locate ${article} ${item-article: 15[2]}. However, if that proves difficult, ${article} ${item-article: 14[2]} or ${article} ${item-article: 13[2]} will suffice.${prompt}

When you have readied all the items and my fee, bring them here and I shall begin my work. However, please understand that programming artificial intelligence is not a simple thing. Many moons may pass before we are able to install your automaton's new head.${prompt}
The turban, the scroll, and the coin. Yes, everything seems to be in order.${prompt}

I shall begin work on your automaton's new head right away. As I mentioned before, programming artificial intelligence can prove remarkably time-consuming. I ask that you stop by every now and then to check on my progress...${prompt}
...and maybe bring a cup of the Empire's finest roast when you do. Ahahaha!${prompt}
I have just begun working on your order's artificial intelligence nodes. The road to completion is still long and winding.${prompt}
I have made much progress in the AI programming, but I still have much spell data to input.${prompt}

Ah, good news, ${name-player}! The craftsman who carves all my automaton heads dropped by yesterday morning with your order. Now I need only insert the control center and make a few minor adjustments. Our journey is almost over.${prompt}
I have had so much work these past weeks... I can barely keep my eyes open, let alone my mind focused...${prompt}
Ah, just what the doctor ordered! Your generosity is much appreciated, ${name-player}!${prompt}
Ah, you have come at a good time, ${name-player}. Your new head is complete!${prompt}
Witness the Soulsoother C-1000--the pinnacle of automaton technology--guaranteed to transform your companion into the perfect protector, the savvy savior, the ever-loyal leecher!${prompt}

Witness the Spiritreaver M-400--the pinnacle of automaton technology--guaranteed to transform your companion into a deadly dealer of damage, a scheming spinner of spells, an unholy harbinger of hexes.${prompt}
Though, whether your automaton will ever realize its potential is completely up to you--its master. Forget this not, ${name-player}.${prompt}
You obtain the Soulsoother C-1000 head!${prompt}
You obtain the Spiritreaver M-400 head!${prompt}
If you wish, I will construct you a new head for your automaton's Stormwaker Y-700 to optimize its efficiency in battle.${prompt}
Automatons have it made. It would be nice if we could also just equip an attachment and become a whole new person, wouldn't it?${prompt}
Then maybe he would finally notice me...${prompt}
Oh! I'm sorry. No, you don't need to know about that. I was just talking to myself...<blush>.${prompt}
Wow, you've got your very own automaton!${prompt}
But you need to know that this basic model is like a newborn baby. It can't do anything until you help it grow.${prompt}
Customize it with attachments, and you can finally bring out its true power!${prompt}
Even if you've acquired an attachment for your automaton, it won't do you any good unless you know how to use it.${prompt}
If you would like to customize ${entity: 0}, you must hand me the attachment you would like to equip.${prompt}
Then I can fit ${entity: 0} with connectors so that you can equip your new attachments.${prompt}
Okay, now that I've got your ${item-singular: 0[2]}, let me just plug in this connector here and...${prompt}
You will have to equip it and experiment for yourself to see what features it adds to your automaton.${prompt}
You can now equip your automaton with ${article} ${item-article: 0[2]}.${prompt}
It looks like I've already fitted your automaton with the connector for that attachment.${prompt}
Ah, ${name-player}! How kind of you to visit me at my humble studio.
Just applying the finishing touches to my latest work, here...${prompt}
All I need is--<ahem>--that one part we spoke of, and this beauty will be complete.
Yes, you should be able to find it around Mount Zhayolm, I'd wager.${prompt}
Any luck hunting down that rare part for me?
Perhaps you should seek out a veteran treasure hunter, or one acquainted with the environs.${prompt}
Phew! Another grueling day at the workshop.
What's that? You've recovered the part for me?${prompt}
Splendid! I'm just about to head out for the day, so if you could just deliver it to--<ahem>--the agreed-upon location, all should be in order.${prompt}
Greetings, ${name-player}. I heard that, ah, a certain someone's waiting for an opportunity to thank you in person.
I was just--<ahem>--going to head over that way myself, so perhaps I'll see you there.${prompt}
(I tell you, ${name-player}, ever since Lord Razfahd returned, her Majesty has been quite literally bounding about the palace in joy.)${prompt}
(I must confess, it brought a tear to this old Galka's eye as well.)${prompt}
(I did tutor the boy as a child, you know.
Were it not beyond my station, why, I'd say I think of him almost as a son of my own.)${prompt}
(In any event, we owe you a true debt of gratitude.
Orders upon orders! It's all work and no play for the busy puppetcrafter.
My apologies, but could you return another time?${prompt}
Oh, and ${name-player}...the--<ahem>--business partner of whom we spoke said he's eagerly awaiting your arrival.${prompt}
(A divine receptacle--a marvel of science, born of the centuries-long struggle of our forbears...
Now we repair it, only to demolish it again like so much scrap metal.)${prompt}
(How foolish we were to presume that we--mere mortals--could wield the power of the divine.
Still, there must be another way, and we will--no, we must--find it someday.)${prompt}
(Ah, but forgive me, ${name-player}. I'm sure you have more pressing matters to attend than one scientist's idle ramblings.)${prompt}
(We shall call upon you if we have need of your services again.

“Sanction” is a magic spell that we use to observe and assess mercenaries' actions.${prompt}
Defeating enemies while you have Sanction cast on you will raise your Imperial Standing. Also, the stronger the monsters you fight, the higher your Imperial Standing will become.${prompt}

When fighting in a beastman stronghold that has taken the Astral Candescence, your Imperial Standing will rise by a significant amount as thanks for your participation in the recovery effort.${prompt}
Sanction is also necessary in order to receive crystals from the enemies you defeat.${prompt}
But you must take caution. Stepping too far out of the Empire's boundaries will cause Sanction to wear off.${prompt}
You can raise your Imperial Standing by defeating enemies while you have Sanction cast on you.${prompt}
Saving a captured prisoner in a beastman stronghold and submitting archaic mirrors to Imperial guards will also result in an increased Imperial Standing.${prompt}
You can view your Imperial Standing by selecting “Besieged” under “Region Info.”${prompt}
You can also speak to me at any time to exchange your Imperial Standing credits for items.${prompt}
“Besieged” occurs when the beastman armies breach the walls of Al Zahbi.${prompt}
Everyone in town who is capable of wielding a weapon is called to action to defend Al Zahbi alongside the Imperial Army.${prompt}
The beastmen's main purpose is to enter the Hall of Binding and wrest the “Astral Candescence” from the Empire's control.${prompt}
You need not know what the Astral Candescence is.${prompt}
All you must know is that it is your duty to protect the five Serpent Generals who hold the keys to the Hall of Binding, and to drive the beastman hordes from the Imperial capital.${prompt}
The Empire's safety and its future rest on your capable shoulders!
Rest assured that you will be rewarded for your efforts.${prompt}
The Empire's defense is entrusted to five generals.${prompt}
Each possesses a name corresponding to the symbols of the Empire--the serpents of flame, water, stone, gales, and sky.${prompt}
Furthermore, the mirrors used to open the Hall of Binding are divided among their possession. Thus, the generals' fates determine the tide of battle.${prompt}
If all five generals should fall in battle, the Hall of Binding will open, and the beastmen will be able to seize the Astral Candescence.${prompt}
It is your responsibility to prevent such a disaster from happening. We are depending on you!${prompt}
When the Astral Candescence is safely resting on its plinth in the Hall of Binding, it emanates waves that bestow special bonuses to Sanction.${prompt}
The first bonus is a slight boost to the amount of experience points received from battles. You will receive this effect simply by having Sanction cast on you.${prompt}
There are several other bonus effects, but you must sacrifice some of your Imperial Standing credits in order to receive them.${prompt}
Keep in mind that the bonuses become more powerful with the number of times the Imperial capital is successfully defended.${prompt}
Sanction's strength will reset if the beastmen succeed in invading the Hall of Binding, though.${prompt}
The waves emanating from the Astral Candescence in Al Zahbi bring a multitude of blessings to all of us. You must not let it fall into the hands of the beastmen!${prompt}

If the beastmen manage to take the Astral Candescence, its recovery will become our top priority. Find the coveted item on a plinth in one of the beastman strongholds and seize it back for the Empire!${prompt}
We aren't quite sure what the beastmen are scheming to do with such power, but we do know that the Astral Candescence's waves can increase the beastmen's strength.${prompt}
As if that weren't enough, we have recent reports that the beastmen have set “archaic mirrors” in their strongholds to magnify the power of the waves.${prompt}
If you should come across any archaic mirrors, take them immediately and ${color: 5}trade${color: 1} them to an Imperial guard.${prompt}

Hey, I haven't seen you around here before. You wouldn't happen to be one of those “adventurers” everyone's been making a fuss over, are you?${prompt}
I work together with a guy named Wazyih to solve the people of Aht Urhgan's problems.${prompt}
We're like you adventurers, only we don't leave town.${prompt}
Actually, I'm afraid Wazyih's not the sharpest knife in the drawer, so I end up doing all the work.${prompt}
Have you ever met Wazyih before?${prompt}
Lately he's been acting kind of fishy...like he's hiding something, or...${prompt}
Wazyih, what the hell is wrong with you? Don't surprise me like that!${prompt}
I-I'm so sorry. I didn't mean to...${prompt}
Whatever. You'll do it again anyway.${prompt}
Well, give me your report. You were out guarding the streets, right?${prompt}
Th-that's correct, sir. Ummm...well, that is, you see...${prompt}
Huh? What is it that you dropped? Explain yourself!${prompt}
Ummm...well... This merchant asked me to...${prompt}
Merchant? Oh no, don't tell me you...${prompt}
Well, I know we refused, but she looked like she was really in a bind, so I told her I would deliver it myself...${prompt}
So, anyway, I took her package and headed to the Commoner's Ward...and wouldn't you know it? Beastmen attacked when I got there...and chased me...${prompt}
And when I was running...the package... I-I...I dropped it!${prompt}
And you knew how dangerous the Commoner's Ward is!${prompt}
And you went off alone without consulting me first? What were you thinking!?${prompt}
Not only that, but you even managed to drop the woman's package...${prompt}
You've got a lot of nerve to show your face to me again!${prompt}
Don't you “but” me! You should have refused!${prompt}
Think about the consequences of your actions!${prompt}
Chasing every pickpocket you catch word of...${wait-36: 2}${prompt}
Charging after random thugs to take back their loot...${prompt}
Jumping down from the city walls to stop a fight!${prompt}
Not to mention jumping right into the ocean to retrieve a dropped item...${prompt}
Is there anything you've managed to successfully accomplish alone?${prompt}
All you ever do is get yourself hurt and then come running to me!${prompt}
And just who do you think...${wait-36: 2}
I-I'm sorry. I'll just go find...${prompt}
I've had it! I can't put up with this anymore... We're through, Wazyih!${prompt}
I've heard enough from you already! The very sight of you makes my blood boil!${prompt}
Anyway, our partnership is over! If you're so eager to get your nose into trouble, then get your tail over to Mamook or the Arrapago Reef!${prompt}
Ah, Saliyahf! There you are! I have a report for you!${prompt}
We've got a big problem on our hands!
There's a rough and rowdy lot harassing a woman on Balrahn Way!${prompt}
Yes! And not only that...the culprits appear to be mercenaries from abroad!${prompt}
You're our only hope, Saliyahf! Please, you must save her, or she'll...${prompt}
W-wait a minute! Just...just give me a moment. You go on ahead of me, and I'll be there soon.${prompt}
I've heard mercenaries are pretty strong...${prompt}
You heard the man. Let this go, and soon everyone will be suspicious of people from abroad.${prompt}
First, you should go and just make sure everything is okay, all right? Um, I'll be right behind you.${prompt}
Tiyaash mentioned a girl being harassed on Balrahn Way.${prompt}
You should go check it out. Don't worry... I'm right behind you.${prompt}
Oh, hello. I haven't seen you before. Are you an adventurer?${prompt}
My name is Wazyih. Together, Saliyahf and I are the defenders of Aht Urhgan!${prompt}
We're a lot like you adventurers, really, but we only work in town.${prompt}
Actually, I'm not much help to tell the truth. I mean, the other day, I...${prompt}
...Never mind. I doubt you want to hear about that.${prompt}
I think Saliyahf is probably somewhere around Philosopher's Alley...${prompt}
What? A woman is being harassed by mercenaries? I've got to go help her!${prompt}
Ummm... Which way was it again? Ah, I've got to hurry!${prompt}
Who are you and what do you want!?${prompt}
Hohoho, look what we have here. Here I was thinking Aht Urhgan was going to be the pits, but they've got some pretty cute women here, eh?${prompt}
Hey, cutie. Want to show me around town? I promise to properly reward you. Heh heh...${prompt}

What would you like to know about?
The basic rules of Brenner are as follows:${prompt}
First, the participants divide into two teams. Each side's camp contains the same number of “Flammen-Brenner.”${prompt}
At the beginning of the match, half of each side's Flammen-Brenner will be ablaze with “Flamme,” or flame, while the other half will remain unlit.${prompt}
Participants can seize a Flamme from the opposing side's Flammen-Brenner and carry it around the Isle.${prompt}
The goal is to steal your opponent's Flamme and use them to light your side's Flammen-Brenner.${prompt}
The side that succeeds in lighting all of its Flammen-Brenner will be declared the winner after a specified amount of time.${prompt}
If neither side is victorious before the match ends, the outcome will be judged based on the score. The “match score” section of the rulebook contains more information on this subject.${prompt}
Brenner is significantly divided into public and private matches. Official matches are held periodically according to level and feature general participation.${prompt}
You cannot reserve the Isle when an official match is being held.${prompt}
No items are necessary for participation, but a minor fee will be collected. You will be unable to participate if your level is too low.${prompt}

The match outcome will be recorded unless the number of participants fails to exceed ${number: 0} members, or if there are fewer than ${number: 1} members in a match where the two sides' numbers differ. In such cases, the game will be considered a training match and will not be recorded.${prompt}
Private matches require a reservation, and participation may be limited. The ${color: 5}Master of Ceremonies${color: 1} (MC) can freely adjust the rules and control match proceedings.${prompt}
“LS Liga” is a form of private match. You can learn more about LS Liga by speaking to a Marshal.${prompt}
A Flammen-Brenner is a device that contains a Flamme (flame). The Flammen-Brenner is covered by a grate that will open after taking a set amount of damage, exposing the Flamme.${prompt}

The participants must utilize this chance to seize the Flamme before the grate recloses. Once the grate is closed, the Flammen-Brenner will begin recovering from the damage it has been dealt.${prompt}
If you manage to open the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner and capture their Flamme, you should make haste to light one of the Flammen-Brenner on your side.${prompt}
After a certain amount of time, the Flamme will burn out and the opposing team's Flammen-Brenner will be relit.${prompt}
Also, please note that you cannot quicken your pace using any special abilities while you are in possession of a Flamme.${prompt}
In the event that neither side fulfills the conditions for victory, the outcome of the match will be evaluated based on score.${prompt}

Ten points are awarded to each side for every lit Flammen-Brenner, while one point is awarded whenever a Flamme is captured, used to light a Flammen-Brenner, or recaptured from an opponent. One point is also awarded for protecting the Flammen-Brenner for a certain period of time.${prompt}
Like Ballista, ${color: 5}quarry${color: 1} (/quarry) can be used while playing Brenner. Participants may use this ability to dig up ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} and temporary items.${prompt}
However, unlike Ballista Petras, Brenner Petras have no effect on the match score. You can ${color: 5}trade${color: 1} a Petra to a Pursuivant to recover your HP and MP at no expense to TP.${prompt}
${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} cannot be used while carrying a Petra. Also, please note that the ${color: 5}scout${color: 1} ability cannot be used in Brenner.${prompt}
Petras will be lost in the event of a KO, but can be carried over from one match to another.${prompt}
The ${color: 5}sprint${color: 1} (/sprint) ability can be used to increase the player's speed when not in possession of a Flamme or Petras.${prompt}
In the event of a KO, you will be returned to your team's camp. However, recovery will take longer the more often you fall in battle.${prompt}
In other words, you will receive a penalty if you fall immediately after recovering from KO. In addition, your TP will be reduced to zero and you will lose any Petras in your possession.${prompt}
I'm sorry. I wasn't listening. Could you start over from the beginning?${prompt}
What do you wish to know about?

Ballista is an exercise once used by the San d'Orian armies to train the Royal Knights in the art of the siege. The word “ballista” means “to throw a stone,” and the game has been a part of Vana'dielian military history for centuries.${prompt}
Ballista is played by two teams over a number of hours (Vana'diel time). The team with the most points at the end of the match is the victor.${prompt}

Players from both teams must search for ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} that a ${color: 5}Herald${color: 1} has buried in various locations across the battlefield. The players must then take these stones and throw them into targets known as ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1}.${prompt}
These ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1} can appear in various locations around the battlefield, and both teams are allowed to throw their ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} into them.${prompt}
Finally, a player's strength is adjusted depending on his or her level. It is felt that this ultimately allows for a more balanced battle.${prompt}

${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} can be buried anywhere. Once a player believes he or she has found one, the ${color: 5}Quarry${color: 1} (/quarry) command should be used to dig up the area at his or her feet.${prompt}

Sometimes a player may find items other than ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1}, such as potions. These ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} can only be used during the current match (or Best of Three series).${prompt}
(1) Successfully throw them into a rook.

But don't forget, a player will be unable to use the ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} command while in possession of a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}. And, players can only use the ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} command if they carry one of the stones.${prompt}
As one can see, careful planning and impeccable timing are the keys to victory.${prompt}

All participants of Ballista will have the ability to use the ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} command. This will temporarily increase one's movement speed, creating a better chance to find and obtain ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1}.${prompt}

However, remember that once a player has obtained a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}, he or she will be unable to use the ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} command. In its place, though, one may use the ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} command.${prompt}
The locations of the ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1} are constantly changing. This makes it quite difficult to find the targets by just randomly walking about the area.${prompt}

Communication with one's team members is, of course, one way to locate ${color: 5}Rooks${color: 1}. However, another way is by using the ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} command. This will inform a player of the approximate location of the nearest ${color: 5}Rook${color: 1}.${prompt}

Finally, ${color: 5}Scout${color: 1} can only be used when a player is carrying a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1}. Because ${color: 5}Sprint${color: 1} cannot be used at this time, players must be weary of approaching enemies.${prompt}
So, a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1} has been obtained and a ${color: 5}Rook${color: 1} located. Now all that's left is tossing the stone in, right? Wrong.${prompt}
There is one aspect of Ballista that has yet to be mentioned...and this is where the real battle begins.${prompt}

To throw a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1} into a ${color: 5}Rook${color: 1}, a player must first wait until the ${color: 5}Rook's${color: 1} gate is open. This takes impeccable timing, as the gate is only open for a short while.${prompt}
Only then will his or her shots count.${prompt}
This extreme method of combat is what made the ancient game of Ballista famous, and transformed its participants into heroes.${prompt}
Running about looking for stones is no different from a child's game of hide-and-seek. Knowing when to strike is what separates the men from the boys.${prompt}
The following match types are area-specific:
All or Nothing (one match) * Normal Items Allowed: Jugner Forest
All or Nothing (one match) * Normal Items Restricted: Pashhow Marshlands
Best of Three (three matches) * Normal Items Allowed: Meriphataud Mountains${prompt}

Winning a match will earn a nation one “match point.” The nation with the most match points at the end of the series will be declared the victor. Winning the third and final match and producing the high scorer will result in two match points awarded. This allows both sides the chance for “come-from-behind” victories.${prompt}

Between each of the matches, a short interval will be implemented. During this interval, Invisible and Sneak will be cast on all participants. We suggest this time be used to discuss strategies with the other members of your nation's forces.${prompt}

Players will be forbidden from using any items they bring to the battlefield. Only temporary items that are quarried may be used. A total of fifteen temporary items (though only one of each type) can be carried.${prompt}
When this rule is in effect, all players will be presented with five complimentary temporary items at the beginning of the match.${prompt}
For more information on temporary items, refer to the “special rules.”${prompt}

After being KO'd, if a player chooses to be revived at the spot he was defeated, 100% of all HP and 50% of all MP will be restored. In addition, the player will maintain 50% of the TP he had earned.${prompt}
If a player chooses to return to their force's camp, HP and MP will be fully restored, but all TP will be lost.${prompt}
Please note that many of the rules previously considered “special” have been fully implemented.
Also, several new special rules have been added.${prompt}

Previously, participants in Ballista were required to use an item the moment they dug it up using the /quarry command. However, players can now stock these items as ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} for use at any time during the match.${prompt}

Players can hold up to ten ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1}, but only one of each type. If a player finds an item that they already possess, they must use it immediately or throw it away.${prompt}

If players who possess ten ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} find an item that they have not already obtained, they will also have the option to exchange it with one of their current items.${prompt}

Also, players will not, at any time, be allowed to trade temporary items. However, there are items that can be used on other Ballista participants. Please note that players may not be able to use these special items as soon as they are quarried.${prompt}
Finally, the Heralds will collect ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} when the match (the third in a Best of Three series) has concluded.${prompt}
Ballista Points are rewarded to each competitor based on his or her performance in a single Ballista match. The maximum number of points that can be accumulated per match is ${number: 0}.${prompt}

While it is taken into consideration, scoring ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} is not the only way to earn Ballista Points. Assisting allies and defeating members of the enemy forces can also earn a high score.${prompt}
Ballista Points can be traded for special “vouchers,” which may be exchanged for free ${color: 5}temporary items${color: 1} at the start of new matches.${prompt}
However, remember that depending on the level restriction of the match, certain vouchers will not be redeemed at the beginning of a match.

Players will only be allowed to score up to five ${color: 5}Petras${color: 1} at a time. Also, a player's ${color: 5}Gate Breach${color: 1} status will be automatically disengaged if a ${color: 5}Petra${color: 1} is not scored within a certain amount of time. The amount of time is increased for those members of the team currently behind in points.${prompt}
All allies within a certain radius will achieve ${color: 5}Gate Breach${color: 1} status when a member of the enemy forces is defeated.${prompt}
Players' resistance to sleep will be increased.${prompt}

During the entry period, from ${number: 0}:${number-2-digits: 1}, all adventurers will be allowed to join the forces with the smallest number of participants, regardless of allegiance. Open entries will be accepted until both sides have reached maximum capacity.${prompt}
In order to ensure balanced matches, the following level limits are enforced:
Please note that any participant who cancels his or her registration will not be allowed to re-apply for the same match.${prompt}
When the total number of participants in a match is less than 40, the location of the two camps will be adjusted. Also in this case, the number of Rooks will be reduced to two.${prompt}

Any adventurer whose main level is over 30 will receive EXP for participating in a Ballista match. However, no EXP will be rewarded if the adventurer fails to actively take part in the match.${prompt}
Read which chapter on B.P. Ranking?
Ballista Point Ranking is based upon all Ballista Points registered from the past ten matches in each of the three participating battle areas.${prompt}
Anyone who wishes to take part in the ranking needs to register ${choice-player-gender}[his/her] points within four hours (Vana'diel time) from the end of the previous match.${prompt}
After the registration period ends, players can compare their record with those of the previous nine matches.${prompt}

If, at any time, a player ranks in the top ten (overall) or first for a specific job, ${choice-player-gender}[he/she] will have the opportunity to receive a special ${color: 5}chevron${color: 1} as well as a new ${color: 5}title${color: 1}.${prompt}

There are four types of chevrons and titles awarded to top-ten players (gold/mythril/silver/bronze), as well as two different types awarded for outstanding performances by players of each of the twenty-two jobs.${prompt}

Wearing a chevron during a Ballista match will automatically change a player's current title. If a player wishes to possess this title after a match as well, ${choice-player-gender}[he/she] must contact a certain bard in San d'Oria.${prompt}

Whereas the hind legs seemed more suited for walking than the traditional jumping one might expect from an amphibious land dweller.${prompt}
That was when I realized that we had not found the bones of a common toad, but a completely new and unique species!
I can sense what you are thinking...${prompt}
It was as if we had discovered something directly from the pages of the well-known fairy tale, “Poroggo and the Prince.”${prompt}
And it is indeed from the famous frog princess, Poroggo, that we took the name for our new beastman.${prompt}
My theory was that over millions of years, the toads of Sarutabaruta adapted to their surroundings and evolved into this higher life form.${prompt}
I immediately took my findings to the Board of Akademia in Jeuno, but the fools simply laughed at me!${prompt}
Yes, it is true, I had no explanation for the discovery of “unevolved” toad bones near those of the Poroggo...${prompt}
But I knew that there had to be evidence that remained yet uncovered.${prompt}
There had to be a “missing link” that would prove my theory!${prompt}
And then, one day while poring over some of the Optistery's more sensitive tomes, I came across a most intriguing passage.${prompt}
...the Poroggo we found in Windurst Waters...${prompt}
...they were actually toads transformed into hideous creatures by the forbidden magicks of an eccentric mage named Samariri!${prompt}
It was difficult to accept that my original theory was incorrect.${prompt}
However, as a scientist, it was the only choice with which I was left.${prompt}
After my failure in Sarutabaruta, I felt I needed to put some distance between myself and the Middle Lands.${prompt}
And that is when I decided to pack up my equipment and ventured forth here, to Aradjiah, in search of new knowledge.${prompt}
And until recently, I have kept myself quietly busy with studies of the colibri and the chigoe.${prompt}
That is until I received word of a Poroggo sighting in the Mamool Ja Savagelands!${prompt}

According to the ancient tome I found in Windurst, all the Poroggo were exterminated by the Federation's mages immediately after their “accidental” creation. Though, ever since I discovered a peculiar footprint near the bungalow of my acquaintance, Pabool Ja, I have begun to believe otherwise.${prompt}
Recently, there have even been adventurer reports of toadlike creatures residing in the damper areas of the Mamool Ja stronghold.${prompt}
What I would like to find out is where these beastmen came from.${prompt}
Are they descendants of the Poroggo spawned from the spellweaving of some spoiled Tarutaru?${prompt}
Or, are they a completely different species, evolved from mere toads as stated in my original theory?${prompt}
And! How are they able to transform their unexpecting victims into frogs?${prompt}
The only way to come to satisfactory scientific conclusions is through research!${prompt}
And so I planned an expedition into the savagelands to search out the elusive Poroggos and witness firsthand the instant a victim falls prey to their unique ${color: 5}frog song${color: 1}.${prompt}
But before I could set out on this trip, I required a volunteer...${prompt}
Ah, I'm sorry if I alarmed you. Your services will only be required to fend off...unwanted guests.${prompt}
The noble Salwa-Molwa will be our guinea...er...toad.${prompt}

Salwa the Unworthy, at your service.${prompt}

${name-player}. Am I safe to assume that you are familiar with the quickest route to Mamo--?

No... I believe this is the scheming of a Poroggo.${prompt}

We can safely assume that the Tarutaru was Salwa-Molwa. However, why in the world would he be chasing away the very beastman we seek?${prompt}

Either way, it seems best if we continue our expedition as planned.${prompt}

This whole situation is quite similar to that old fairy tale...${prompt}

Well, after what seemed like hours of chasing, the Poroggo finally ducked away into this cave...${prompt}

Now, I am a man of science. I could never resort to killing a fellow living creature. That is where you come in, ${name-player}.${prompt}
Now, as for distinguishing 'your' toad from a more common specimen...${prompt}
Professor! I think I can tell which one is my Miki!${prompt}
I mean, I did chase her through the forest for almost an hour.${prompt}

While I do not question your feelings towards Mikilulu...${prompt}

If only there were another, more reliable method...${prompt}

Toadprints! And quite fresh, by my calculations.${prompt}

I guess that's why they call you “Professor”!${prompt}

To the west of our current location lies a small lake that is rumored to be one of their breeding grounds. We shall first try our luck there.${prompt}
And if anything attempts to attack us, I am sure our trusty mercenary here will handle it.${prompt}
And exactly the same shape as the last! I feel we are getting close...${prompt}
But this one is considerably larger... No doubt from the Poroggo that abducted the poor Mikilulu. This suggests that they are still traveling together.${prompt}
I do not see any Poroggo in the area.
Hurry! We must capture her while she is alone!${prompt}
Let me make sure her print is the same as the one at the entrance.${prompt}
Mikimiki! Why did you go and run away from your Salwa? You don't know how worried I was!${prompt}

Correct. Though, I highly recommend we do so at a location safer than this.${prompt}
Hmmm... Just as I had feared.${prompt}
Wait! Come back here, you stinky, slimy frogman!
I--I don't think I can handle this guy by myself... He's all yours, ${name-player}!
You did it! Now Miki will...${prompt}
I do not understand... The spell should have been broken the instant the caster became incapacitated.${prompt}

The print is the same as the one we saw near Mikilulu's.${prompt}
I also believe I witnessed your lady friend respond to one of the Poroggo's commands during the battle.${prompt}
Finally, you can see that the subject has calmed down quite considerably since her captor's defeat.${prompt}
Then if this is really Miki, and that is really the culprit, then why is she still a toad!?${prompt}
That, my boy, I cannot say. My data has never failed me before...${prompt}

Yes, and I also said that slaying the caster would break the curse...${prompt}
Let us rethink this from a scientific standpoint, shall we?${prompt}

First of all, it is clear that the tissue mutation is merely a physiological reaction to a particular medium that has been introduced into the victim's body via the sound waves of the frog song.${prompt}
This reaction continues until the whole body is affected, thus reducing him or her to the shape of the assailant.${prompt}
The concept is much similar to that behind the strange liquid medium that transforms its consumer into the shape of a Mamool Ja.${prompt}
Now, whether the sound waves of the frog song actually carry the medium...${prompt}
...or simply act as a catalyst, activating a genetic medium already present in the victim's body, I cannot say.${prompt}
That was to be the focal point of this expedition's research.${prompt}
As for the victim's actions while in the transmogrified state, it seems that one loses the ability of voluntary thought, leaving him susceptible to the will of the caster.${prompt}
We can derive from this that the Poroggo must be sending some type of neural signal directly to the victim's brain.${prompt}
I believe this signal may also affect the medium I spoke of earlier.${prompt}
By taking control of the nervous system, the Poroggo is able to override the victim's natural defenses--in particular, the defenses that prevent foreign mediums from invading the body.${prompt}
The signal also may trigger the spontaneous generation of a new medium in the body by stimulating certain areas of the cerebral cortex.${prompt}
To put it in layman's terms...${prompt}
To maintain the transmogrified state, there must exist a continuous physiological reaction.${prompt}
In other words, the Poroggo must keep sending inhibitor signals to the victim, or the reaction will cease.${prompt}

In theory, maintaining these signals would require extreme levels of concentration. This explains why most victims return to their original state after extended periods of time--when the caster becomes fatigued or distracted.${prompt}
And if we apply these same conclusions, then we can easily explain why defeating the caster would immediately nullify the effects of the song.${prompt}
However, as we can see here, the victim, Mikilulu, remains in the transmogrified state despite the fact her assailant has met his demise.${prompt}
Which suggests that she may not return with the simple passing of time.${prompt}

The potency of the physiological reaction has been known to vary depending on mental condition of the victim. It is possible the song resonated with something deep within Mikilulu's subconscious.${prompt}
Wait a minute... Are you trying to say that my girl has always been a frog!?${prompt}

Though, there may be a more reasonable explanation.${prompt}

I am sorry, Salwa, but you shall just have to wait until then to reunite with your lady friend.${prompt}

...and before I knew it, I was back to my old self!${prompt}

...we can conclude that the song is merely a catalyst, and it is the victim himself that maintains the actual transmogrification.${prompt}

(((And only a toad that beautiful would be worthy enough to play the part of Princess Poroggo!)))
(((How is practicing to be a frog going to help you return to normal!?)))
(((That's all I wanted to hear, Salwa.)))${prompt}
Is there anything you wish to say?
The girl was a toad all along!
You have a keen sense of perception, ${name-player}.${prompt}
I, too, had considered that possibility.${prompt}
However, I lack the evidence required to construct a proper theory.${prompt}
So, why not conduct tests on Mikilulu right away?${prompt}

Listen carefully, ${name-player}. In the world of science, just because new light is shed upon a dark room of questions does not necessarily mean that light will lead you to the answers you seek.${prompt}
Especially when there are still many more lights remaining to examine before racing off blindly after a single one.${prompt}

I will continue to collect my small truths and piece them together until I can complete the final picture. Whether this takes months or even years, there is no need to rush science. She will show me what I seek when she deems it the right time to do so.${prompt}
And, who am I to disturb a loving couple the moment they find their happiness?${prompt}
Nevertheless, these events prove that the truth is often stranger than fiction, wouldn't you say?${prompt}
Pleasantries aside, the whole thing closely resembles the tale of “Poroggo and the Prince.” Why, the two are even planning a marriage, it seems.${prompt}
I believe I mentioned earlier that a good scientist does not mix science and fairy tales.${prompt}
Though I have learned much in the past few days, there is still little information on the Poroggo.${prompt}
After some of the amazing things we witnessed, it would be easy to attempt to tie those to superstition.${prompt}
However, this would only lead us farther from the truth.${prompt}
Ridding our mind of prejudice and predetermination, and approaching a problem with a clean slate is the only way to find what we seek.${prompt}
I believe this can be said for adventurers as well as scientists.${prompt}
${name-player}, it has been a pleasure working with you, and I hope that our paths cross again in the future.${prompt}
Ah, yes. And before I forget...${prompt}
I hope it aids you on your travels.${prompt}
Please wait a few moments and try inspecting the area again.${prompt}
That glimmer of determination in your eyes...${prompt}
The aura of confidence that can only be felt from one who has overcome unspeakable hardships...${prompt}
There is no mistake about it--you are an adventurer, and no ordinary one at that.${prompt}
How was it that I could tell, you ask? To one with a trained eye, such things are no different to distinguishing a mandragora from a morbol.${prompt}
I've been praying to the Goddess to be delivered one such as you. I beseech you, adventurer, spare me a moment of your time and hear my plea.${prompt}
Oh, you must excuse me. I've completely forgotten my manners. I am Sanraku, a simple traveling painter from the Far East.${prompt}

I have devoted my life entirely to capturing the beauty of nature on canvas. In pursuit of that which would make the perfect painting subject, I have traveled to the deepest hearts of continents and traversed tempestuous seas.${prompt}

Enticed by rumors of Aht Urhgan's diverse and unique fauna, I made my way here with my apprentice, Ryo. But nothing could have prepared us for the darkness that threatens to swallow up the whole Empire.${prompt}
Civilians like us dare not leave the city, lest we fall victim to the prowling hordes of beastmen. Even these mighty sandstone walls do little to stay the relentless besiegers.${prompt}

I had all but given up hope that any fruit would be borne of my journey to Aht Urhgan. In fact, we were about to pack up and leave on the next ship to Mhaura when you appeared. Surely, it was by the divine grace of the Goddess that you have been led here.${prompt}
Will you not lend us a hand, noble adventurer? The task I have in mind for you is straightforward, and I will make sure you are well compensated for your valuable assistance.${prompt}
Let me first provide you with some background information.${prompt}

Aht Urhgan is home to numerous technologically advanced inventions, among which the automaton is most famous. The invention that has caught my interest, however, is a lesser known contraption known as a “soultrapper”--truly a marvel of science. It has the ability to capture visual images onto objects called “soul plates.”${prompt}
I want you to venture out into the wilderness in my stead and seek out and capture images of Aht Urhgan's fauna, using the soultrapper.${prompt}
I would sooner be on location with paintbrush in hand, if it weren't for the hostile climate. This is why we are in dire need of your aid, adventurer. There is no one else we can rely on.${prompt}
If you have any specific questions, my lovely apprentice here will be delighted to help you.${prompt}
Our hopes rest upon your able shoulders, noble adventurer.${prompt}
Our hopes rest upon your able shoulders, noble adventurer.${prompt}
What would you like to ask about?
Speak to me again after you've reorganized your inventory.${prompt}
Oh, it seems you are already in possession of one.
In that case, you will not be requiring another.${prompt}

I appreciate you bringing me more ${item-plural: 1[2]}. However, I'm afraid I can only accept up to ${number: 2} for each ${number: 0} ${choice-plurality: 0}[day/days]. After all, we need to travel light.${prompt}
Of which creature would you like to know?${prompt}
For information on that creature, a deduction of ${number: 6} zeni from your account should be adequate.${prompt}
Oh dear, I'm afraid you do not have enough zeni. I would dearly love to furnish you with the information, but rules are rules.${prompt}
For this piece of information I will need to receive your tally seal also.${prompt}

I will ask you once more: Are you positive that ${choice: 0}[Vulpangue/Chamrosh/Cheese Hoarder Gigiroon/Iriz Ima/Lividroot Amooshah/Iriri Samariri/Armed Gears/Gotoh Zha the Redolent/Dea/Tinnin/Brass Borer/Claret/Ob/Anantaboga/Reacton/Dextrose/Nosferatu/Khromasoul Bhurborlor/Achamoth/Sarameya/Velionis/Lil' Apkallu/Chigre/Wulgaru/Zareehkl the Jubilant/Verdelet/Mahjlaef the Paintorn/Experimental Lamia/Nuhn/Tyger/Pandemonium Warden] is the creature whose information you desire?${prompt}
Then, I give you this lure item. With it, the creature you seek will surely be enticed into coming out of hiding.${prompt}

I recall a hunter friend well-versed in Aht Urhgan fauna telling me that this creature is native to ${choice: 0}[the Wajaom Woodlands/Bhaflau Thickets/Mount Zhayolm/Caedarva Mire/the Aydeewa Subterrane/Mamook/Halvung/Arrapago Reef/the Alzadaal Undersea Ruins].${prompt}
Your adventurer's instinct should reveal to you the suitable location to place the lure. I have every confidence that you will not fail to locate that which you seek.${prompt}
Then, I give you this key. You will need it to gain access to the Pandemonium Gate in order to arrange an encounter with the Pandemonium Warden.${prompt}
According to folklore, the gate appears somewhere within the Aydeewa Subterrane.${prompt}
Your adventurer's instinct should reveal to you the suitable location to use the key. I have every confidence that you will not fail to locate that which you seek.${prompt}
You wish to know how to gain access to islets?${prompt}
The islet in ${choice: 6}[the Wajaom Woodlands/Mount Zhayolm/Caedarva Mire], you say?${prompt}
For information on how to gain access to that islet, a deduction of ${number: 6} zeni from your account should be sufficient.${prompt}
Aaah, my apologies, friend. While I burn to reveal this information to you, without sufficient zeni, I cannot oblige your request.${prompt}
Take this salt with you. At ${choice: 6}[Wajaom Woodlands/Mount Zhayolm/Caedarva Mire], you will find a most unusual stone tablet emitting a soft light from its engraving.${prompt}
Sprinkle the salt onto the tablet, and your journey to the islet will be over quicker than you can say “Pandemonium Warden”!${prompt}

There is one thing to keep in mind, however. Should you hear a tinkling sound like that of a bell even after sprinkling the salt, you cannot yet access the islet. You would be well advised to try again another time.${prompt}
Oh my, is that a soul plate you have brought for me?
If I could be permitted to do the honors...${prompt}
Magnificent! Truly a triumph in photography!
My faith in you is obviously well placed!${prompt}
Hmmm... Surely you can do better than this, my friend. But I will accept it nevertheless.${prompt}
Why, this is...! So you were successful in subduing the creature? You are indeed an adventurer worthy of admiration!${prompt}
Please accept this Far Eastern tally seal as a symbol of my faith in you.${prompt}
A single tally seal is proof positive of your prowess as an adventurer. You shan't be requiring another.${prompt}
Ah, please forgive me. My master, Sanraku, whom I respect and revere, has forbidden me from engaging in conversation, as it will disrupt my attunement with nature.${prompt}
Greetings, adventurer. My name is Ryo, apprentice to Master Sanraku. The master has instructed me to assist you in whatever way possible.${prompt}
Good day, ${name-player}. How may I be of service?${prompt}
What would you like to ask about?
The criteria for a good image.
You currently have ${number: 0} zeni in your account.${prompt}

Ah yes, zeni... This may require some explaining. A keen eye and peerless attention to detail are attributes that made Master Sanraku the artistic genius that he is. The very same things, however, have also given him a somewhat calculating personality.${prompt}
Take zeni, the Far Eastern currency, for example. This is Master Sanraku's way of keeping track of your contribution to his objectives.${prompt}
Bringing him a soul plate image of fauna will earn you virtual zeni in your account. For your information, the account keeper is me.${prompt}
On the other hand, Master Sanraku will deduct zeni from your account as a fee for providing information on fauna.${prompt}
While I do not entirely agree to Master's cumbersome methodology, as a mere apprentice it is not my place to make comments.${prompt}
This goes without saying, but the subject must be well framed in the shot.${prompt}
And preferably, be of a creature in which Master is interested.${prompt}
However, like his inability to stay faithful to one woman, his subject of interest is also prone to change.${prompt}
One last thing. If you show me your soul plates before giving them to the master, I can give you an estimate on their worth in zeni.${prompt}
The pursuit of beauty in nature is often accompanied by unavoidable hazards. There are times when one has no choice but to slay an aggravated creature in self-defense.${prompt}
When you defeat such a creature, bring back evidence of your feat to show to Master Sanraku.${prompt}
From his numerous journeys across the globe, Master Sanraku has come to admire the courage and honor displayed by adventurers.${prompt}
If you can prove your triumph over a formidable foe, the master will be pleased and reward you with a tally seal from the Far East.${prompt}
Consider it a symbol of his faith in your ability. Please note, however, that it isn't just for show. There is nothing for which Master Sanraku does not have a purpose.${prompt}

In the Wajaom Woodlands, Mount Zhayolm, and Caedarva Mire, you will find strange stone tablets that emit a soft glow from their engravings. These objects are thought to be a legacy of a long lost ancient civilization.${prompt}
Legend says that sprinkling salt onto these tablets will teleport you to mystical islets.${prompt}
Being a skeptic at heart, Master Sanraku couldn't resist the temptation to put this legend to the test, which he verified as fact.${prompt}
Upon his return, he ranted on for weeks on end about the rare fauna he witnessed on these islets, like a young boy who had seen an airship for the first time.${prompt}
I recall Master Sanraku using some variety of sea salt.${prompt}
Unfortunately, I haven't yet had the privilege of seeing the islets with my own eyes.${prompt}
But Master Sanraku will undoubtedly be pleased to have the opportunity to tell someone about his experience.${prompt}
You can obtain a soultrapper by going to the Colosseum in the southeast area and speaking with a man named Zandjarl.${prompt}
Is there anything else with which I can assist?${prompt}
Please do not hesitate to ask me if there is anything you wish to know.${prompt}
You've brought me a soul plate for appraisal?${prompt}
This sample should earn you approximately ${number: 0} zeni.${prompt}

The synergy furnaces you see around town are provided as a public service by the Bastokan Institute of Synergy Research, to ensure that no synergist is ever far away from the tools of their trade.${prompt}
The synergist must provide his or her own ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]}, as well as any materials to be used in the synergy process.
Provided those conditions are met, synergy furnaces may be used free of charge.${prompt}
Needless to say, only one party may operate any given furnace at once.${prompt}
Fortunately, there are multiple furnaces installed throughout town.
If the furnace before you is already in use, please seek out an unused one elsewhere, or wait patiently for your turn.${prompt}
You may think of synergy as an evolved form of synthesis.
It is a discipline full of heretofore unimagined possibilities, but one which demands consummate skill from its practitioners.${prompt}
Like synthesis, synergy involves combining materials according to a prescribed recipe to yield oft-spectacular results.
The rub is that each synergy recipe also dictates a certain elemental balance that must be achieved for the procedure to be successful.${prompt}
This balance is achieved through skillful infusion of combustible elemental crystals that we synergists call “fewell.”
To begin the synergy process, you'll have to feed the furnace with fewell and get those flames burning!${prompt}
As a general rule, the more complex the recipe, the more fewell it will require.
Take care to check your stock before you fire up the furnace, lest you find its flames guttering out at a crucial moment.${prompt}
With the belly of the furnace roaring up a storm, it's time to toss in your materials and start synergizing!

Keep a close eye on the balance of elements and deploy fewell as necessary. Approach the prescribed elemental balance, and your item will take form, allowing you to remove it from the furnace.${prompt}
The closer you are to the ideal elemental balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.
In synergy, it pays to be a perfectionist!${prompt}
But be forewarned: these furnaces can only sustain the elemental maelstrom swirling and storming inside them for so long.${prompt}
If the furnace's durability should fail, the synergy process will be interrupted, and you will be forced to start anew.${prompt}
Take heart, though, as any materials inside your ${keyitem-singular: 0[2]} will remain intact.
You may retrieve them or attempt the synergy process again as you see fit.${prompt}
Any fewell consumed in the failed synergy attempt, on the other hand, will be permanently lost.${prompt}
Synergists must also be wary of debris buildup, an unavoidable side effect of the volatile elemental reactions that take place within the synergy furnace.${prompt}
Should too much debris be allowed to accumulate, the contents of the furnace will become unstable, potentially leading to unpleasant explosions and eruptions.
Such accidents pose considerable risk to the synergy attempt in progress, as well as the physical well-being of the synergist, so be sure to exercise due caution!${prompt}
You may be asking yourself, “Why, how in the name of Hildolf am I going to oversee all of these complicated procedures and variables by myself?”${prompt}
Here's the good news: you don't have to!
For you see, synergy furnaces are designed for use by multiple operators.${prompt}
The more complex the recipe, the greater level of skill and hands-on manipulation it will demand.
At such times, it would be in your best interest to seek out like-minded synergists and take on the challenge together.${prompt}
Finally, it would be remiss of me not to make mention of ${item-singular: 0[2]}, the curious substance whose properties are only now--with the emergence of synergy--becoming known to us.${prompt}
Though there is much yet to be learned, our research has revealed that ${item-singular: 0[2]} may be used to bolster your equipment, if attached in a proper manner.${prompt}
Mind you, ${item-singular: 0[2]} is not easy to come by, and I can offer no clues as to where or how to obtain it.
Should you be fortunate enough to come across some in your travels, however, I encourage you to explore its potential.${prompt}
Synergy is not a discipline for the faint of heart or mind, but with dedication and cooperation, there are great rewards to be reaped.
May your career as a synergist prove fruitful!${prompt}
First, you'll be wanting to check your fewell supply.
You may do so by speaking with a synergy engineer such as myself, or by examining a synergy furnace.${prompt}
You'll be needing at least one unit of fewell for each element dictated by your recipe.
Without this, even the most skilled synergist cannot hope to succeed.${prompt}
Should your fewell supply be in order, it's time to proceed with the synergy.
If you are using one of these public synergy furnaces here, you'll need to examine it and lay claim to its use.${prompt}
You may then deposit your ingredients. Should they correspond to a proper recipe, the synergy furnace will fire up automatically.
Note that as a safety precaution, the furnace will not activate if the recipe is beyond your level of synergy skill.${prompt}
From here, it becomes a race against the clock!
Through skilled operation of the synergy furnace, you must achieve the elemental balance prescribed by the recipe before the furnace's durability fails.${prompt}
Fortunately, synergy furnaces are outfitted with a wide array of features designed to aid the synergist in this demanding task.
First, you'll want to confirm the current balance of elements within the furnace and compare it to your desired result.${prompt}
Feeding fewell into the furnace until the required elemental balance is achieved is the most fundamental operation of synergy.${prompt}
However, high concentrations of elemental power can lead to volatile and unpredictable reactions.
Simply adding fewell haphazardly without making the necessary adjustments is a recipe for only one thing, and that's disaster.${prompt}

If you sense that the furnace is on the verge of elemental overload, you'll want to employ the ${color: 5}safety lever${color: 1} and ${color: 5}pressure handle${color: 1} to prevent an unfortunate accident from occurring.${prompt}
You'll also want to mind the laws of elemental ascendancy and opposition.
Increasing the concentration of a particular element will cause its counterpart to decrease.${prompt}
The furnace cannot sustain its power indefinitely, and will gradually lose durability as the synergy process continues.
While this will not impact the success or failure of the process itself, it will result in a greater amount of salvageable cinder produced as a by-product.${prompt}
This cinder is of great interest to our researchers back at the institute.
As such, we have introduced a reward system through which quality samples can be traded in for an assortment of synergy-related wares.${prompt}
As marvelous an apparatus as the synergy furnace may be, keep in mind that the technology is still in its infancy, and highly unstable.
There may be times when accidents occur despite the best efforts of the synergist.${prompt}
For your safety, we recommend stepping as far away from the furnace as possible at the first sign of danger.
Some synergists claim that giving the furnace a good thwack is also effective in preventing such accidents, but this is pure madness, if you ask me!${prompt}
You will also find that there are numerous techniques that can be applied to make the synergy procedure go even more smoothly.${prompt}
In many cases, expertise and knowledge acquired through crafting will serve you in synergy as well.
To truly master synergy, one must master crafting as well.${prompt}
Now let us return to the synergy process itself.
As your elemental balance approaches that prescribed by the recipe, the furnace will signal you, and you may retrieve your finished product.${prompt}
If the furnace is still holding strong at this time, you may choose to keep working to achieve an even closer balance.
The closer you come to the ideal balance, the higher the quality of your finished product will be.${prompt}
Indeed, many synergy masters consider these waning moments after the signal to be the time to really show off their skills!
Why, if they manage to achieve an elemental surge...${prompt}
What's an elemental surge, you ask?
Why, it's a miraculous phenomenon that occurs rarely--ever so rarely--upon feeding the furnace fewell.${prompt}

The elements react just in the right way, creating a miraculous reaction that brings the level of elemental concentration to exactly the desired level. Truly a boon from the Goddess for any synergist, no?${prompt}
...And that is the synergy process in a nutshell.
There's quite a bit of information to take in, so don't hesitate to return any time for a refresher course.${prompt}
Much like synthesis, to fashion items through synergy, you will need to follow a recipe.
We synergy engineers are always unearthing new recipes, and are happy to share with you those suitable for your level of skill.${prompt}
Unlike synthesis, however, a synergy recipe is more than just a list of ingredients.
There is also a required elemental balance that must be attained to achieve your desired result.${prompt}

Simple recipes involve only small doses of a limited number of elements, but more complex ones require the synergist to skillfully juggle wide ranges of elements in extremely high concentrations.${prompt}
The ingredients, you will have to remember on your own.
The required elemental balance, however, may be reviewed at any time during the synergy process by observing the readings on the synergy furnace.${prompt}

In particular, recipes through which the curious substance known as ${item-singular: 0[2]} can be attached to equipment are creating quite a buzz among synergistically inclined adventurers these days.${prompt}
